intro: Pentacalia carrikeri var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are broad and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are erect and branching. This variant is distinguished by its larger leaves compared to other varieties within the Pentacalia genus.
